name: biomni-perform-chipseq-peak-calling
title: Biomni: Perform Chipseq Peak Calling
description: Identify genomic regions with significant protein binding using MACS2 peak calling
content:
Overview

Identifies genomic regions with significant protein-DNA binding or chromatin accessibility using MACS2 (Model-based Analysis of ChIP-Seq) peak calling algorithm. This tool analyzes ChIP-seq or ATAC-seq data to detect enriched regions where transcription factors bind or chromatin is open, accounting for local biases and background signal.

Input Parameters

  • chipseq_file (string): Path to ChIP-seq treatment read data file in BAM or BED format from stash
  • control_file (string): Path to control/input read data file in BAM or BED format from stash
  • output_name (string, optional): Prefix for output files (default: macs2_output)
  • genome_size (string, optional): Effective genome size - hs (human), mm (mouse), ce (C. elegans), dm (Drosophila) (default: hs)
  • q_value (float, optional): Minimum FDR (q-value) cutoff for peak detection (default: 0.05)
  • output (string): Output directory path

Input Format

Provide a JSON file with the following structure:

{
  "chipseq_file": "/path/to/treatment.bam",
  "control_file": "/path/to/input.bam",
  "output_name": "myTF_peaks",
  "genome_size": "hs",
  "q_value": 0.01,
  "output": "/output/directory"
}

Biological Use Case

Fundamental for analyzing ChIP-seq and ATAC-seq experiments. Used to identify transcription factor binding sites, map histone modifications, discover regulatory elements, detect open chromatin regions, and create high-confidence peak sets for downstream motif analysis and functional annotation.

Output

Generates macs2_log.txt with peak calling statistics and standard MACS2 output files including narrowPeak/broadPeak files with genomic coordinates, summit positions, fold enrichment, and statistical significance for each peak.

Category

genomics
